Author: Strob#3417
Content: I finally managed to get my node back to more than 30 not within 6 hours. I removed all the unnecessary settings in .conf to get back to the most simple one (I was trying to see if I could force more ram usage to help but it didn't). Yesterday I also shrank my wallets so it may have helped too.

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: If you take this argument to (ridiculous) extremes  KMD also matters,  if all the nodes had UTXO split count of 2 there are frequently KMD blocks that happen where all NN  supply of usable UTXOs would be depleted.  We would not be able to cover all the transactions.

Author: NNoperator#3835
Content: My point remains, as we continue to get more and more AC to notarize, and if a good fraction of NN choose to splitfunds in low single digits, we better stock up on KMD UTXOs because we are going to burn through them much faster.  It would be interesting thought experiment to figure out the amount (assuming all NN split the same) of UTXOs where KMD would deplete for all NN in a single block.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: split to 50 every 10minutes... covers over a 100 chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: more chains increase to 100

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: diffrenc from 50-10 0 isnt a lot, less than 50 is zero diffrence. Use thge lowest amount you can sustain tobe in every notarization.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if you have too little number, you wont be able t oparticipate and will notarize less. Pretty simple

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do you guys think average time between notarizations is a good metric of up time?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: like if you don't notarize for days, it negatively impacts you?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I really think notarization counts alone is a flawed metric because of latency

Author: Alright#0419
Content: regions are meant to alleviate this effect, but they aren't great at it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think a penalty for down time is reasobable, can be a modifier to the `score` that is alrady used... but it can punsh people for real life emergencies etc also.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is like DAA, well meaning changes, no matter how small can have some really bad effects

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: current dPoW algo isnt perfect, but it is tuned and it works

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: changing it in anyway risks making it worse

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yea I understand, not proposing changes right now, just throwing out ideas

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Wouldn't latency also have a bearing on time between notarizations?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes cris

Author: Alright#0419
Content: *if*(big if) we were to make changes, they have to be well thought out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think going to a dedicated DPOW chain would eliminate all the ping time and most server differences

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: And tested.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the only changes, I see possible is if a node doesn ntoarize anything for a day, remove som score... doesnt seem that many nodes do that as it is.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but that is a total overhaul of the entire dPoW network

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that makes that chain a single point of failure I believe

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also opens it up to hashrate attacks, etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, that is what I mean by similar to DAA

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: where the simplest well meaning changes allows some horrible timewarp attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so what is the super horrible apocalyptic problem that requires to change dPoW?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: nothing really, I just think the latency thing encourages bad things like all nodes in same DC

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and running dangerously low amounts of utxos... but anyone who does this in a production server with lots of chains will fail to notarize so I dont see it as an issue.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is self correcting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is like changing PoW equipment because some miners use silly inefficient equipment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ASIC resistance!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the purpose of dPoW primarily is to secure the networks. The game theory of NN is to maximize notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as the maximum notarization helps overall security, this is both simple  and aligned

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont think there is any actual proof that better ping time helps notarizations in statistically meaningful ways

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly a node with horrible connectivity wont do well, but that is not surprising

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the notarization protocol takes many seconds to complete. ping times less than a second likely wont affect results that much

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if 80% of nodes are in EU, the other nodes cant notarize as much, this is fact. But this is a testnet/labs anomaly becuase there are no regions.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: And regions seems to be the most effective to max notarizations with some decentralization.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is not my fault testnet didnt require regions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so why does lack of regions in testnet make it some sort of reason to change dPoW algo?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`ping + listunspent call time` 
This is what I found, if you ahve bad ping time, decrease listunspent time negates it a LOT. We are talking far less than 1s mening the diffrence between last and top in SH region from my testing. (that is if other nodes didnt optimize listunspent call time also)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so why not cache listunspent results?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: allocate utxo from a fixed list until it is used up, then refill cache

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is an implementation issue, not algo

Content: I hacked up listunspent to return a single 0.0001 utxo each time

Content: but I didn't really gather real data on it

Author: Alright#0419

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no offense, but such anecdotal result is not meaningful

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yes agreed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: filtering listuspent to return just 1 result does nothing, as it still needs to read the entire wallet.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only a fully debugged, efficient utxo cache and release system is valid

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just sharing my thoughts, not supporting one view point or the other with them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you need to do a litunspent every say 15mins, save the result then remove each utxo from the list every time they are chosesn

Author: jl777c#5810
